snippet: A Moscow court sentenced a former Soviet intelligence officer on Friday to 13 years in a prison colony for plotting an armed coup against the Russian government.
abstract: Moscow court sentences Vladimir Kvachkov, former colonel in Soviet military intelligence service, to 13 years in prison colony for plotting armed coup against Russian government.
lead_paragraph: A Moscow court sentenced a former Soviet intelligence officer on Friday to 13 years in a prison colony for plotting an armed coup against the Russian government.

headline.main: Russia: Officer Jailed in Coup Plot
headline.print_headline: Russia: Officer Jailed in Coup Plot
